risk_factors: The individual’s risk factors include a criminal history (1 arrest and conviction), recent drug use, reported depressive moods, unstable employment (4 jobs in one year), and living alone in an urban setting. These factors combined suggest potential behavioral and social challenges that could elevate risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a risk assessment expert. Analyze the following risk factors to determine if they indicate high risk.
You must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}

Risk Factors to analyze:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 6 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 4 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with adults other than biological, foster or adoptive parents in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.
